meta.description: Fluidoracle test fixtures derived from Eaton customer success stories
sources: Return-line filters deliver reliable performance to keep mining equipment working on schedule (Eaton, 2021)
Custom designed filter system reduces weight in wind turbine gearboxes (Eaton, 2021)
Reliable filtration in the Siberian winter with duplex filter (Eaton, 2021)
Hydraulics and lubrication high pressure filters on board high speed trains (Eaton, 2016)
meta.scoring: keyword_match — response must contain N of M required terms to pass

test_cases.title: Return-line filter type for mining vehicles
test_cases.question: A European mining equipment manufacturer needs hydraulic filters for their vehicles extracting copper and coal. The system uses ISO VG 32 and 46 hydraulic fluid, operating temperatures of 68 to 158°F, working pressure up to 145 psi, and flow rates between 26 and 106 gal/min. What type of filter is appropriate for this application and where should it be placed?
test_cases.note: Requires Eaton application content (not yet ingested)

test_cases.title: Fixed maintenance schedule and DP monitoring
test_cases.question: A mining equipment operator changes hydraulic filter elements on a fixed calendar schedule regardless of actual usage. Filter performance was poor with the original specified elements, causing unscheduled replacements and extended downtime. What monitoring approach and filter features would you recommend to better manage element service life and avoid unscheduled maintenance?
test_cases.note: Requires Eaton application content (not yet ingested)

test_cases.title: ISO VG 32 vs 46 cold start ΔP implications
test_cases.question: Mining vehicles operate with ISO VG 32 or VG 46 hydraulic fluid across a temperature range of 68 to 158°F. The maximum working pressure is 145 psi on the return line. What are the cold-start implications for filter sizing, and how should the bypass valve setting be selected relative to the element collapse pressure rating?
test_cases.note: Requires Eaton application content (not yet ingested)

test_cases.title: Filtration requirements for wind turbine gearboxes
test_cases.question: A wind turbine manufacturer wants to reduce weight in their nacelle gearboxes while maintaining high filtration quality. The turbines operate continuously at remote locations. What are the key filtration requirements and considerations for wind turbine gearbox lubrication oil filtration?

test_cases.title: Weight reduction vs filtration performance trade-off
test_cases.question: Wind turbine engineers are trying to reduce the weight of gearbox-integrated filtration systems. What design approaches allow weight reduction while maintaining the required filtration efficiency? What are the risks of compromising filtration quality in this application?

test_cases.title: Target cleanliness for wind turbine gearbox
test_cases.question: What ISO cleanliness code should be targeted for a wind turbine gearbox lubrication system, and what beta ratio is required to achieve it? The gearbox runs continuously and is difficult to access for maintenance.

test_cases.title: Duplex filter justification for critical compressor
test_cases.question: A hydrogen production facility in Siberia runs large piston compressors at pressures up to 5,075 psi. The compressors cannot be stopped for filter maintenance without halting production. What type of filter arrangement is appropriate, and why?
test_cases.note: Requires Eaton application content (not yet ingested)

test_cases.title: Cold start filtration at -58°F
test_cases.question: A compressor lubrication oil filter system must operate reliably in Siberia where temperatures can reach -58°F (-50°C). What are the critical filter design considerations for reliable cold-start performance at these temperatures?

test_cases.title: Filter media compatibility with compressor lube oil
test_cases.question: Compressor lube oil for large piston compressors in hydrogen service must maintain lubricating properties under extreme conditions. What filter media type is most appropriate for compressor lubrication oil filtration, and what media compatibility issues should be considered?

test_cases.title: Filtration for high-pressure servo valve system
test_cases.question: A high-speed tilting train uses a centralized hydraulic power unit with servo valves and piston pumps to control the tilting mechanism. The system operates in a harsh undercarriage environment. What cleanliness level is required for a servo valve system, and what filter rating achieves it?

test_cases.title: Centralized vs distributed hydraulic filtration
test_cases.question: A train manufacturer evaluated two hydraulic system designs: one with servo valves and filters distributed front-to-back under each railcar, and one with a centralized power unit with all filtration in one location. What are the filtration advantages of a centralized system design?

test_cases.title: Filter specification for piston pump protection
test_cases.question: A hydraulic system on a high-speed train uses piston pumps and servo valves in a harsh vibration environment. What filter specifications are needed to protect both the piston pump and the servo valves, and where should the filters be placed in the circuit?
